choices.text:
Write a python function to calculate the average and standard deviation of a list of numbers
Create an input file with your data in it. Then run this program on that same directory, passing as argument its name

## Example output for test_averages() from above example code is shown below; you can see how I have used the average and standarddev functions to calculate these values based off of my own testing:
```bash=-xvf0  test.txt   # This will create a file called "data" with your data in it, which we'll use for our test below

$ python3 calc_averages/calcAverageStdDevTest1.py                                    |&> output2.log ; echo $?
1
```
